taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek ankistron , fish hook, referring to hooked centr al spines, and Cactus , an old genus name]

bio:treatment.discussion: Ancistrocactus is sympatric with three other hook-spined species: Glandulicactus uncinatus, Ferocactus hamatacanthus, and Hamatocactus bicolor. Ancistrocactus has only straight radial spines (Glandulicactus has strongly hooked abaxial radial spines), broadly rounded tubercles of ribs (those of Hamatocactus bicolor and Ferocactus hamatacanthus var. sinuatus are laterally compressed), and plants of reproductive age are much smaller than plants of Ferocactus hamatacanthus var. hamatacanthus.

key_statement.description: Roots short, conic taproots or diffuse, without constriction between stem and root; radialspines 7–14
Roots fleshy, tuberlike taproots with bulbous swellings and/or bulbous secondary roots,always separated from stem by fragile constriction; radial spines 13–28
